message: I’m grateful to Whip Hoyer for this responsibility and I look forward to working with my colleagues in Congress to advance priorities that will help raise the middle class. http://bit.ly/2hQzvdj
I look forward to joining my colleagues on the House Appropriations Committee and getting to work. http://bit.ly/2igVn2k
Empowering our kids with the resources they need to succeed starts at the very beginning, so I’m glad to see these federal funds returned to our community.  http://bit.ly/2jjuC1N

I'm grateful for my new responsibilities in Congress. Looking forward to being the best advocate I can be for Inland Empire families.  http://www.pe.com/articles/aguilar-822581-committee-health.html?page=1

Today I joined my Congressional Hispanic Caucus colleagues to warn House Republicans of the consequences of repealing the Affordable Care Act. We cannot go back to the days when people were denied coverage for having pre-existing conditions, where preventative screenings weren't covered and when simply being a woman was a pre-existing condition.  http://bit.ly/2ikTmF2

My role on these subcommittees will allow me to be a stronger advocate for San Bernardino County to invest in projects affecting our roads, rails and bridges, to better deal with California’s historic drought and to address the need for affordable housing. We have a lot of work ahead and I’m ready to get started. http://bit.ly/2jft48p
As we remember and honor Dr. King, we recommit ourselves to standing together in the fight for justice and equality. #MLKDay2017
Glad to have spent my morning beside volunteers at the Sahaba Initiative for an important day of service and giving back to the San Bernardino Community. #MLKDay

Today, I bore witness to the peaceful transfer of power—a central component to our nation’s democratic process. While I respect the office of the presidency, I harbor deep concerns about the man who has assumed the position. Donald Trump spent eighteen months normalizing racism and sexism. He called Mexicans rapists and criminals, proposed unconstitutional bans and registries for Muslim Americans, bragged about sexually assaulting women, mocked Americans with disabilities, and the list goes on.  Attending today’s inauguration was my duty as a voice for San Bernardino County residents. My attendance was a reminder to President Trump of who will hold him accountable during his term to ensure that Inland Empire families are not made to pay the price for his flawed and dangerous policies.
NA
What a powerful and inspiring morning. Proud to participate in the #WomensMarch and thrilled to see Redlands residents Kathy and Roy in the crowd!
I always have and always will be an unwavering defender of women’s reproductive freedom. http://bit.ly/2j6SNvE

The attack in San Bernardino was one of the deadliest terrorist attacks on American soil since 9/11. As we’ve seen in recent history, no two acts of terror are the same, so it’s important that we have a full understanding of each attack so we can help prevent this type of horror from happening in other communities. Commissioning this report is critical to helping lawmakers and agencies identify ways to strengthen our national security and keep Americans safe.  http://bit.ly/2jqwhkY

On Friday, President Trump issued an executive order that targets refugees and immigrants based on their religion. His xenophobic rhetoric and actions are not consistent with the values of our nation. This executive order will do nothing to make our country safer and only sends a message of hate and bigotry to the rest of the world. This order would not have prevented the attack in San Bernardino and the use of San Bernardino as justification for this anti-Muslim policy is a revolting way to exploit our community.   Federal judges around the country have issued orders to halt detentions and deportations. Despite these orders, the Department of Homeland Security, under the president's direction, is continuing to enforce the executive order and proceeding with detentions, removals and denial of access to attorneys. This is abhorrent. This is inhumane. This is unconstitutional. President Trump's actions are in violation of the United States Constitution and he must be held accountable immediately.

Last night, I traveled to Los Angeles International Airport (LAX) as an advocate for the detainees and to be helpful in any way I could.  I’m glad to see that those who were wrongfully detained have been released. While this is good news, we cannot ignore the deeply disturbing actions that brought us here.   President Trump’s refusal to comply with multiple federal orders that halted detentions and deportations is a stain on our democracy. His actions are reprehensible and illegal. Not only is the president’s Muslim ban a poorly masked act of bigotry – his repudiation of our system of checks and balances violates the United States Constitution. The severity of this offense cannot be ignored and he must be held accountable.

I'm hosting a FAFSA and College Affordability Workshop on Saturday, February 18th from 9:00AM to 11:00AM. If you or someone you know needs assistance with the FAFSA process or has student loan questions, please join us. And remember to bring your FSA ID!

As you may know, the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare, has made health coverage affordable for millions of Americans. A repeal and delayed replacement of the law will cause millions of people to lose their health coverage, while others will be forced to pay more for their insurance.  I'm committed to supporting policies that protect and help San Bernardino County families and those throughout our country. As we go through this process, it's important that I get feedback from constituents like you.  Share your story with me and I'll fight to keep health care coverage accessible and affordable for all Americans. http://bit.ly/2l5429W

Remember, to stay up to date with the work I'm doing on behalf of Inland Empire families, visit my website at aguilar.house.gov. You can also stay engaged with me on Twitter at @RepPeteAguilar and on Instagram at @rep.peteaguilar.

President Trump can't even spell San Bernardino, yet he exploits our community to justify his Muslim ban.  http://thehill.com/homenews/administration/318197-wh-list-misspells-san-bernardino-terror-attack

Today I spoke with Kelly McEvers on "All Things Considered" about the need for the Trump Administration to stop using San Bernardino as a political talking point. Our community needs support and federal assistance to recover, not to be made into political fodder.  Listen in at 3:35PM and 5:35PM on KVCR 91.9FM.

Join me on Wednesday, February 15th at 6:00PM for a Telephone Town Hall.   This is a great way to connect with you while I’m in Washington advocating on your behalf. There are a lot of issues we’re discussing at the federal level that affect our region, so it’s important that I’m able to communicate with you and answer any questions and concerns.  Spread the word!

Today I spoke with CNN's Chris Cuomo about President Trump's continued inaccurate use of the San Bernardino terror attack to justify his Muslim ban. It is both factually incorrect and inappropriate. If the president wants to talk about the attack in San Bernardino, he should focus on helping us get federal funds so survivors can get the care that they need.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RlHTvc5FC-c

On Wednesday, I'll join Jeff Horseman for a Facebook Live Town Hall. Tune in at 10:15AM on the San Bernardino Sun's Facebook page. And if you can't join us in the morning, be sure to join me for my Telephone Town Hall on Wednesday night at 6PM! http://bit.ly/2l914UZ
Quick update! We'll be starting our Facebook Live Town Hall at 10:00AM instead of 10:15AM. Be sure to visit the San Bernardino Sun's Facebook page at 10:00AM to participate.
NA

Big thanks to Jeff Horseman and the San Bernardino Sun for having me on their Facebook Town Hall today. If you couldn't tune in, join me tonight for my Telephone Town Hall at 6PM. http://bit.ly/2l914UZ

I'm glad so many students and families were able to join me this weekend for a FAFSA and college affordability workshop. I wouldn’t have been able to afford college without federal assistance, so I know how important it is to offer workshops and resources like this.Thank you to Patricia and Fermin from Cal State San Bernardino and San Bernardino Valley College for joining us!  http://bit.ly/2l55GIo

Since the Great Recession, small businesses have created about 60 percent of all new jobs across the nation. Supporting and empowering small businesses is important to our regional economy. I'm glad that at my Small Business Advisory Board meeting we were able to continue these conversations and connect #InlandEmpire owners with the federal resources they need to expand and hire.

While we celebrate Black History Month each year, we must remember and honor the contributions of the African American community every day.  Dorothy Inghram was a trailblazer who became San Bernardino County's first black teacher and California's first black school superintendent. #BlackHistoryMonth

Dreamers and many in the immigrant community are terrified—so it’s my responsibility to be here to answer any questions they have, provide additional information and to remind them that I am their advocate. And I’m not going anywhere. http://bit.ly/2kVdD71

We cannot and will not turn our backs on the immigrant community. I stand with Maria and the millions like her who deserve a pathway to citizenship. President Trump has spent nearly two years villainizing the immigrant community and stomping on the values that established this country. This evening, together, we will remind him that immigrants are what ‘Make America Great,’ not his flawed policies rooted in hatred. http://bit.ly/2mADcHO

From demonizing immigrants and refugees to stripping transgender students of basic human rights, President Trump’s actions thus far have spoken far louder than his words. Tonight we heard the president tout his record after one month in office—a record of tearing families apart, vowing to repeal health care for tens of millions of Americans, ending protections for the LGBTQ community and rolling back crucial environmental safeguards. President Trump doubled-down on his actions and reaffirmed his commitment to policies that will hurt San Bernardino County’s middle class. On President Trump’s first day in office, I vowed to hold him accountable for any decisions that threaten Inland Empire families and I remain committed to that promise.

This is the second time a Trump administration official has lied about communication with Russia. Attorney General Jeff Sessions not only had communication with Russia during Donald Trump’s campaign, but he lied about it under oath. Attorney General Sessions broke the law. He must resign immediately and be held accountable for his actions. Additionally, a special prosecutor must be appointed so a full and independent investigation into the president’s ties to Russia can be conducted as soon as possible. http://wapo.st/2mPKEy0

We celebrate Women's History Month in March, but honor women's contributions and achievements daily as we continue to fight for equal pay, reproductive freedom, paid family leave and more. #WomensHistoryMonth http://womenshistorymonth.gov/
Reminder! CyberCorps: Scholarship For Service applications are due May 1st! http://bit.ly/2m4dayd #CSUSB #CyberSecurityEducation

The president's new Muslim ban still would not have prevented the deadly terror attack in San Bernardino, nor would it have prevented any other domestic act of terror. Rather than focus on issues of national security that would make our country safer – like tracking and interrupting lone wolves who self-radicalize or dismantling how terrorists communicate on social media platforms – President Trump prefers demonizing refugees who have fled unspeakable violence. We cannot ignore that Donald Trump campaigned on and is now governing on an anti-immigrant platform. This new ban comes on the heels of numerous stories of Dreamers being arrested and detained unlawfully. This is the wrong approach to strengthening our national security, and will make our defense weaker, not stronger.

Republicans had seven years to come up with a plan, only to reveal a bill that will force Americans to pay more for less coverage. The Republican health care bill was written in secret and hidden from lawmakers and the public until last night. This is not how governing should work. This new health care bill will turn the tables on American families and force seniors and families to foot the bill so the uber-wealthy get tax breaks. We cannot afford this health care bill and neither can the middle-class Americans who will have to pay for it.

The issue of cybersecurity has never been as critical to our national defense programs as it is today. We need to do everything in our power to ensure that we are ahead of the rest of the world on cybersecurity advances, which we can only do if we invest in our talent early. http://bit.ly/2m0kNSU
Writing a bill in secret, hiding it from the public and ramming it through markups in less than 48 hours is not how governing should work. http://lat.ms/2njQl7l

I convened this meeting because it’s critical that I hear from local providers and advocacy organizations about how this health care bill will affect Inland Empire families’ ability to access quality and affordable care. Democrats have asked Republicans to work together for years to improve the Affordable Care Act. Rather than work together to make our current system work for all Americans, Republicans drafted a new bill in secret, concealed it from the public and rammed it through two committee markup sessions in less than 48 hours. This is not how governing should work. We cannot risk stripping millions of people of their health insurance, including those in San Bernardino County, so House Republicans can pass a bill they don’t even know the full repercussions of. http://bit.ly/2nmb8rI

Today’s report confirms what we all feared – House Republicans’ plan to repeal and replace the ACA will strip health care from millions of hard-working Americans, drive up premiums for older adults, and give tax breaks to the uber-wealthy. This bill is being rushed through Congress because House Republicans know it’s a bad deal for middle-class families. This bill was written in secret, hidden from the public and forced through committees in the dead of night. Now we know why. http://bit.ly/2mkw6FY
House Republicans' plan to repeal and replace the ACA will be devastating for Inland Empire families.   http://bit.ly/2nIEe4i

The president’s plan would force Inland Empire families to pay for a border wall between the United States and Mexico, while stripping our community of affordable homeownership opportunities, job training programs, student aid and critical infrastructure investments that our region desperately needs. Donald Trump’s policy priorities are completely inconsistent with the Inland Empire's needs and values. http://bit.ly/2mTOE3k
Great to spend time with students and parents from Cope and Beattie Middle Schools. Thanks for making the trip to DC!

I've received thousands of calls, emails, social media messages and letters from constituents opposing a repeal of the Affordable Care Act (ACA), and sharing their stories of how the ACA has helped them. Today I told one of those stories on the House floor. Daria, thank you for sharing your story with me and letting me remind our leaders in Congress about what's at stake.  To Daria and those like her who have written and called: I'm listening. And I'm not done fighting. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iSf-mkzFnRQ
Investing in cybersecurity is critical to boosting our national defense. That's why I've made it a top priority. http://bit.ly/2mtBrjf

Read my op-ed in the San Bernardino Sun about how the Republican health care bill will hurt middle-class Americans and force Inland Empire families to pay more for less coverage.  http://bit.ly/2mw7xL4
You called. You wrote. We fought. It worked. http://lat.ms/2nQw6me

As Chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, Rep. Nunes is responsible for running a thorough and independent investigation into Russian influence on the 2016 presidential election. Given his role on the Trump transition team, and more importantly, his recent interactions with White House officials and classified information pertinent to the ongoing investigation, I do not believe he can lead an impartial examination  of the president’s ties to Russia and I join my House colleagues in calling on him to recuse himself from the investigation.
Attention art students: it's that time of year! Please feel free to share with friends, family, teachers and classmates. http://bit.ly/2nkxwAT

Today I joined the Congressional Hispanic Caucus for an important meeting with Department of Homeland Security Secretary John Kelly about protecting DACA recipients and keeping families together. I requested that Secretary Kelly be transparent with any sharing of DACA recipients' information with enforcement agencies. He said the Department of Homeland Security has not been doing this, and will be open with us if this policy changes. We will hold him to that.

I'm excited to announce that I'm hosting a town hall on Tuesday, April 18th at the National Orange Show Events Center (the Valencia Room) in San Bernardino. It's important that I’m able to connect directly with constituents to discuss issues affecting our community. Please see the following link to RSVP. I hope to see you there! http://bit.ly/2nYZcgn

My thoughts and prayers go to those affected by the horrific shooting at North Park Elementary School in San Bernardino. I'm in touch with the San Bernardino Police Department and am monitoring the ongoing situation.

I’m devastated by the shooting at North Park Elementary School in San Bernardino. This is like a punch to the gut for our community. My sincere and heartfelt thoughts and prayers go out to those affected by this heinous act. I’m in touch with the San Bernardino Police Department and am monitoring the situation as it unfolds. Once again, we’ve seen the bravery of our region’s first responders who are willing to put their lives on the line to end the violence and keep students safe.   We will learn more in the coming hours and days about how today’s events came to pass.  But there are some things that we know now:  This is a tragedy for our community and there are children, teachers, staff and families who will be dealing with what happened today for a long time.  As we have done before, we need to come together to support those affected and rededicate ourselves to ending gun violence in our community.

I’ve been going to Mitla’s my entire life, so it meant a lot to spend my morning hearing personal stories about San Bernardino from the people I’ve formed relationships with through the years over coffee and eggs. We had important conversations about staff’s day-to-day routines, and providing for their families while serving the San Bernardino community. I’m glad I was able to spend the morning with the Mitla Café family and thank them for sharing their stories with me. http://bit.ly/2p6enYi
Reminder: I'm hosting a town hall in San Bernardino on Tuesday, April 18th! For more information and to RSVP visit: http://bit.ly/2nYZcgn

We're just one day away! Please join me tomorrow night for a town hall in San Bernardino at the National Orange Show Events Center. The event begins at 6:30PM in the Valencia Room. Please call 909-890-4445 with any additional questions. I hope to see you there! http://bit.ly/2oekj0h
If you can't make it to my town hall tonight in San Bernardino, please tune in here to watch it on Facebook Live! We'll be starting at 6:30PM.
Rep. Aguilar's Town Hall
Thank you to everyone who joined me at my town hall last night. Hearing from you at events like this helps me be your best advocate. http://bit.ly/2oOiMML
Reminder: My office is accepting submissions for the Congressional Art Competition until May 1st! Details here: http://bit.ly/2nkxwAT

I'm excited to kick off my #DearPete campaign! Be sure to check in as I post personal responses to constituents. I'm inspired by the letters, calls and social media posts I've received. I hear you and I'm fighting for you. I hope residents will continue to stand up for their families, friends and neighbors by contacting their elected officials. My first post is for a San Bernardino resident who asked me about standing with #PlannedParenthood. Rest assured, #IStandWithPP.  http://bit.ly/2oNNOmr

We're educating and growing the pool of Inland Empire students and cyberwarriors for the 21st century economy. Head over to the San Bernardino Sun to read more about why I'm committed to investing in cybersecurity and to learn about the incredible work that Dr. Coulson and CSUSB do everyday to make our region a leader on cybersecurity education and innovation. http://bit.ly/2oTdf6S

This is a great opportunity for students interested in serving our nation to ask important questions about how they can best prepare to attend our prestigious Service Academies. Please spread the word and give us a call at 909-890-4445 with any additional questions.

As we continue to rebuild from the terror attack in our community, we need to look ahead and work together to prevent this type of tragedy from happening in other neighborhoods across the nation. This bill encourages municipalities to share information with each other and learn for one another so we don’t see another San Bernardino, Boston or Orlando. The REPORT Act is about preparedness; by learning from each instance we can work together to find policy solutions to make our communities more secure and keep Americans safe. http://bit.ly/2qGuZCQ

Legislation that strips 24 million Americans of their coverage and discriminates against millions more who are living with pre-existing conditions is not a health care bill – for some, it is a death sentence. This bill will punish cancer survivors, kids with asthma and diabetes, and women. Women will be at the mercy of their insurance companies over whether or not they have coverage for maternity care. Trumpcare is a heartless policy. Donald Trump and House Republicans should be ashamed of themselves. http://bit.ly/2pdSvHb

I've had dozens of meetings with Inland Empire doctors, hospitals, community groups and patients with pre-existing conditions. Not a single group except for my House Republican colleagues supported this bill. This is truly unfortunate for our region. http://www.pe.com/2017/05/04/house-gop-health-care-bill-passes/

Thank you to all of the students and parents who joined me on Saturday to learn more about attending a US Service Academy. I’m always so impressed by the students we meet at Spring Academy day, who at such a young age already know the importance and honor in attending these prestigious academies and serving our nation. http://bit.ly/2qTF7Jv
In case you missed it: I wrote an Op-Ed in the San Bernardino Sun to discuss the importance of continuing an honest and open dialogue with Inland Empire residents.

Today I announced over $3 million in funding for Cal State San Bernardino’s cybersecurity program. Cybersecurity is a critical aspect of our national defense. By investing in technology and training right here in the Inland Empire, we can enhance our national security while creating jobs and encouraging innovation in our community.

Too often our veterans return to civilian life unable to find the meaningful employment they deserve. I was honored to have the chance to help connect Inland Empire veterans with local businesses today at the Hire a Vet job fair hosted by the California Employment Development Department. Providing our community’s veterans with the resources they need to succeed remains one of my top priorities.

Pell Grants have made college an affordable reality for so many students, including me. Proud to announce today that the FY17 spending bill includes over $22 billion for Pell Grant funding. This money will go a long way toward making college an affordable reality for Inland Empire students.

Thanks to everyone who joined me for Coffee With Your Congressman yesterday in Colton! By having one on one conversations like these, I’m able to get a better sense of the issues affecting Inland Empire families. Events like this one help me be a better voice for you in Congress.

If President Trump asked James Comey to end the FBI investigation into Michael Flynn, that is potentially obstruction of justice. We need an independent investigation and special prosecutor. Now. http://nyti.ms/2pHKU82
We need an independent commission to investigate Trump-Russia connection and possible collusion. Glad to lend my support to this petition. http://cbsn.ws/2rrnO2E
My heart goes out to those affected by this barbaric act of violence. San Bernardino stands with Manchester during this devastating and difficult time. http://lat.ms/2q7bfga

The president’s budget request is a non-starter in Congress. We need to balance the budget and reduce our nation’s deficit but we cannot do this on the backs of middle-class families, which is exactly what the president’s budget would do. http://bit.ly/2q8MZdg

While we hear every day that Washington is broken and compromised by partisan gridlock, we can clearly see that there are issues that both parties can get behind. This is about helping our heroes find job opportunities in our communities. I look forward to working with my colleagues in Congress to see this bill through. http://bit.ly/2qPUiFD

This new analysis confirms what we feared: this isn’t a health care bill at all. Trumpcare will strip tens of millions of Americans of health care coverage by eviscerating Medicaid. Inland Empire children and seniors will be forced to pay the price for Republicans’ political games. Americans with pre-existing conditions will be at the mercy of their health insurance companies as to whether they’ll have access to coverage. And middle-class families will be forced to foot the bill so millionaires and billionaires can get a tax break. This is shameful. http://bit.ly/2qhHFQT

Our veterans deserve the best care we can provide, so it’s important to me that we have an open dialogue. Whether we’re talking about wait times, accessibility or quality of care, it’s critical that we have as much information as possible about what our veterans are experiencing so we know how to work together to get our brave men and women the services they deserve and need to live healthy lives.   Please follow the link to my website to participate in a survey to share your experience at the Loma Linda VA. http://bit.ly/2r4H9Hq
Today - and every day - we honor our fallen heroes who made the ultimate sacrifice defending our liberty and stand beside their families in remembrance.  #MemorialDay
Thank you to our local school superintendents for participating in my Education Roundtable to discuss how we can better support Inland Empire schools.‬
Congrats to these brave young men and women who will represent the Inland Empire at US Service Academies in the fall!

I’m grateful to the Goodwill Southern California team for letting me join them to learn more about the work they do for our community. The work that Goodwill does, both as an immediate resource for those in need and as an outlet to help workers learn new skills and get back on their feet, is important for families in our region and many more across the country. http://bit.ly/2rplsUD

The United States should be leading the global fight against climate change, not running away. Ignoring scientific evidence and shirking our responsibility to protect the planet for future generations is disgraceful and unravels years of progress. The president’s decision to withdraw from the Paris Climate Accord hurts our credibility in the international community and puts the sustainability of our environment and economy at risk.

Ensuring our seniors have access to the quality of care that they need and deserve requires more than passing bills in Congress – it’s about directly connecting them with resources right here in our community. Over the past two years, my senior fairs have helped hundreds of Inland Empire residents resolve Medicare or Social Security claims, learn about important food programs and get access to critical free health screenings. I’m glad to host another senior fair and will continue to hold constituent service events like this in the future. http://bit.ly/2skfRzx

For most Dreamers, the United States is the only home they have ever known, so it’s important that these young people understand that they have an advocate in Congress fighting for their educational and economic opportunities. I’m grateful that members of my Immigration Advisory Board and local representatives, including staff members from the Mexican and Guatemalan consulates, were able to join us and talk with the students about how they can make the best of their future here in the Inland Empire. http://bit.ly/2s5QUr4

We remember and honor the 49 innocent lives taken one year ago at Pulse nightclub in Orlando and pledge to never remain silent in the face of hate. Today, and every day, San Bernardino stands with Orlando. #OrlandoUnitedDay

I’m horrified by the attack at the Republican baseball practice this morning. The Congressional Baseball Game is a tradition that allows us to pause and put politics aside so we can come together to support a good cause—it represents the very best of who we are. My thoughts and prayers are with Whip Steve Scalise, Capitol Police and staff who were injured in this hateful and horrific act of violence.

Tonight I'll take the field with my colleagues in the Congressional Baseball Game, an event I look forward to each year. This will be my third game.   We will not give in to fear, violence or hate. We will play for those affected by yesterday's despicable and cowardly actions, to support local charities, and to remind the American people that this violence will not define or divide us. http://bit.ly/2trnfGd
Share your Loma Linda VA experience with me so together we can work to improve health care for Inland Empire veterans. http://bit.ly/2r4H9Hq
I'm live now, talking about my new bill, the REPORT Act, on the House floor. This bill will give Congress the tools to combat future acts of domestic terror.

This afternoon I spoke on the House floor and urged my colleagues to support the REPORT Act, my bipartisan bill to combat domestic terror. I'm glad to announce that it unanimously passed the House of Representatives.   In the days and weeks after the terror attack at the Inland Regional Center, we pledged to do all we could to prevent another attack like this from ever happening again, and that is exactly what this bill will help us do. http://bit.ly/2sQRwlJ
This week's #DearPete was to assure an 11 year-old that despite the president's rhetoric, his immigrant parents are welcome in the #InlandEmpire. #CA31
Happy to share that my bill, the ADVANCE Act, is included in Senators John Cornyn (R-TX) and Elizabeth Warren’s (D-MA) legislation to help our heroes find work at home. http://bit.ly/2sX64Qf

Senate Republicans’ health care plan will kick millions off of Medicaid and make it all but impossible for the sick and elderly in many parts of the country to afford care. I'll continue to oppose #Trumpcare because it's not a health care bill; it's a tax cut for the rich at the expense of middle-class families.

Tune in now as I join my colleagues on the House floor to debate my bill, the ADVANCE Act. I’m proud to offer this legislation that will make it easier for military personnel to transition to the civilian workforce.

I introduced the ADVANCE Act to ensure that active-duty service members and reservists have access to the same benefits as veterans, helping to smooth the transition from military to civilian life. We owe it to our brave men and women to help them find work here at home. This bipartisan bill is a commonsense measure that will create opportunities for service members to find work in their communities by simplifying how they translate the driving skills they learned in the military to American jobs across the nation. http://bit.ly/2sfRcZb

The Santa Ana River Wash Plan Land Exchange Act will allow San Bernardino County to take advantage of critical economic and environmental benefits. I commend Congressman Paul Cook on his efforts to push this forward and was glad to join him on this bill. http://bit.ly/2tUT5fT

Do you need help with Social Security or Medicare? Do you have questions about your veterans benefits? If so, please stop by my Senior Fair on Friday, July 7th from 9AM to 12PM in Colton. We'll also have additional information on food programs and free health screenings. Please call my office at 909-890-4445 with any additional questions or concerns. http://bit.ly/2tY6Kmb
Today I responded to Margaret's letter to assure her that I'll always fight to protect her hard-earned Social Security and Medicare. #DearPete

Jack H. Brown was a staple in the Inland Empire community, both as a business leader but also as an advocate for charitable causes. From supporting our kids through the founding of the San Bernardino Boys and Girls Club, to advocating for Inland Empire veterans, to donating tens of thousands of dollars to our local law enforcement in the aftermath of the Inland Regional Center terror attack, Jack always put our families first. The designation of this post office, which sits in the center of San Bernardino, will remind our residents every day of his service to our community. http://bit.ly/2tpUQna
Thanks to our #CongressionalArtCompetition winner Gemma Delgado for making the trip out to Washington DC. I’m proud to have a piece of #CA31 hanging in the Capitol!

Reminder! My Senior Fair is on Friday, July 7th from 9AM to 12PM at Colton High School in the Ken Hubbs Gymnasium. If you need assistance with Social Security, Medicare or veterans benefits, please stop by! We'll also have additional information on food programs and free health screenings, and lunch will be served. Please call 909-890-4445 with any additional questions.
From my family to yours, happy 4th of July!

I’m glad to see state leaders take action on behalf of students across the country who are struggling with crippling student debt, including those in the Inland Empire. I called on Secretary DeVos to help San Bernardino County students who were taken advantage of and left without a clear path toward getting their degrees, but it’s only been met with silence from this administration. We must do more to improve college affordability in this country and I remain committed to working with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to see that through. http://bit.ly/2sRR2aI

Thank you to everyone who made it out to my Senior Fair today! If you weren’t able to attend today but have questions about Medicare, Social Security or veterans benefits, please visit: https://aguilar.house.gov/services/help-with-a-federal-agency

I’m glad I got to spend some time yesterday with the General Micro Systems team in Rancho Cucamonga! Thank you for all you do for the #InlandEmpire community and for your support for our troops overseas.
My "Job For A Day" tour is all about connecting with working people across the #InlandEmpire. Alejandra Molina with the Press Enterprise has more here:

Rep. Aguilar's staff is hosting a workshop for students looking for information on U.S. Service Academies. Staff members will be on site to answer questions and connect interested students with Military Academy representatives. The workshop will include information sessions with Military Academy representatives on the admission timeline, admission requirements and preparation, the application process, course loads, available degrees, expectations and more. For additional information, please contact Jared Bosman by phone at 909-890-4445 or by email at jared.bosman@mail.house.gov.  Rep. Aguilar's Spring Academy Day will be held at Redlands East Valley High School (in the Harry Blackstone Theater), which is located at 31000 E. Colton Avenue, Redlands, CA 92374.
Trumpcare drains funding from Medicaid to line the pockets of billionaires. The only way forward is to focus on fixing and protecting the ACA. #ProtectOurCare

The Inland Empire is brimming with thriving local businesses and a talented workforce, but we waste that potential on both ends if we cannot connect the two. I originally introduced this bill in 2015 after meeting with local business owners, veterans and community leaders who expressed frustration with the skills gap, and two years later, I hear the same concerns. Closing the skills gap is an important way to help get our local economy back on track and put San Bernardino County residents back to work. http://bit.ly/2ukDERq

Today I responded to a letter from Julie in Alta Loma, whose life was saved when she accessed insurance coverage through the Affordable Care Act. I promised her that I will keep fighting to protect her health care. #DearPete

These young men and women identify as Americans, living in the only country they have ever called home. Denying Dreamers the opportunity to serve their community and country through public service stands in stark contrast to our nation’s core values. Expanding the pool of applicants for our federal workforce will ensure we can get the best and brightest applicants, whoever they may be. This amendment makes a commonsense change to give Dreamers the opportunities they deserve and our nation the workforce it needs.

Some of the greatest threats facing our nation are born in cyberspace. We need to make sure we’re constantly investing in the training and retention of a workforce that has the abilities and resources required to defend against attacks we face from our adversaries and rogue actors. Prioritizing cybersecurity is critical from a national security standpoint, but it also plays a significant role in the Inland Empire community, where we are training the cyberwarriors who will be on the front lines of the fight. http://bit.ly/2v1dOzb

When the attack in San Bernardino occurred, we became the site of the worst terrorist attack since 9/11. Had it not been for the heroism of our local law enforcement and first responders, we would have lost more innocent lives that day. Their incredible response is an example of how critical preparedness is in situations like this, and that’s why I’ve continuously fought to ensure that our community has the resources it needs to prevent, prepare for and respond to extraordinary emergencies. http://bit.ly/2u28ugt
Share your Loma Linda VA experience with me so together we can work to improve health care for Inland Empire veterans. http://bit.ly/2r4H9Hq

Sadly, our community is no stranger to tragedy, and in the aftermath of such extraordinary emergencies, it’s critical that we have the resources available to help those affected by the violence to recover and heal. These funds are welcomed and will be put to good use to help restore the learning environment and manage the ongoing healing process at North Park Elementary. http://bit.ly/2tneRfH

CSUSB is a leader in cybersecurity education and is helping to put the Inland Empire on the map. When we talk about what Dr. Coulson and Dr. Nestler are preparing our students for, we’re looking at economic and national security priorities for our country. By investing in these great opportunities, we’re training and preparing a workforce for jobs of the 21st century economy that will be at the forefront of our nation’s most critical defense programs. http://bit.ly/2uDumPN

When our veterans come home, they deserve the best care we can provide, and that starts here in our community. There are important resources, advocacy organizations and assistance programs in the Inland Empire that can help our veterans, but we need to do a better job connecting our veterans with those vital services. My resource fair will help bridge the gap and get veterans the support they need to live healthy lives. http://bit.ly/2vo1t86
NA

I’m happy to announce my #CA31Photos Contest! Please send your best photos of California’s 31st Congressional District to CA31photos@mail.house.gov and include a brief description of your photo as well as where it was taken. The deadline is Friday, August 18th. The winner will be featured as my Facebook cover photo!
Legislation like the bipartisan #DreamAct gives DACA recipients a chance to build their lives in the only home they’ve ever known. Today and every day, I stand with Dreamers. #DefendDACA

We have a lot of work to do, from the halls of Congress to our local communities, to make sure Inland Empire veterans and service members have the leadership and advocacy that they deserve. That’s why I will always be here to listen and learn from our veterans so we can ensure they have the voice and the leadership that they need.  If you or someone you know needs veterans benefits assistance and cannot attend my Veterans Resource Fair on August 18th, please call my office at 909-890-4445. http://bit.ly/2uRZn2u

Watch live as I urge my colleagues to oppose any efforts to include divisive policy proposals that would fund President Trump's border wall in a bill that is supposed to provide funding for our troops, veterans and critical defense programs.

I was glad to see Republicans and Democrats come together to oppose a reckless bill that would strip millions of health care coverage. We need to have an open process with bipartisan support to improve the Affordable Care Act so it works for all Americans. Fixing our health care system shouldn’t be about keeping a campaign promise – it’s about doing what’s right for American families.

It’s my job to break through the gridlock in Washington and deliver for Inland Empire families. I’ll work with any Republican or Democrat as long as it means my community has a seat at the table. We have a lot of work to do to ensure San Bernardino County residents have the tools they need to find good-paying jobs, and have access to affordable health care and a quality education. I will continue working across the aisle to deliver those results. http://bit.ly/2uRYQMb

Had it not been for federal student aid, I wouldn’t have been able to afford my college education. With student debt exceeding one trillion dollars in the United States, we need to do everything we can to ease the burden on families and students. Limiting a college education to only those who can afford it stands in contrast to our national ideals and priorities, and prevents us from helping people realize their full potential. Inland Empire students deserve a fair shot and that’s exactly what this bill helps us do.

My thoughts and prayers go out to the family and crew of Brent Witham, who tragically lost his life in the line of duty. Brent was a hero. We will never forget his bravery and the conviction that he showed in his work as a first responder, risking and ultimately giving his life to protect our communities. I hope you'll join me in remembering him and keeping his family in your thoughts tonight. http://bit.ly/2vyulNC

I'm glad to announce my Inland Empire Jobs Fair. If you or someone you know is looking for work, I hope you'll stop by on August 25th at the San Bernardino Boys & Girls Club. Please feel free to share this information with anyone who may be interested. http://bit.ly/2wrVArb

I had a great time at Burrtec Waste Industries in Fontana as part of my ‘Job for a Day’ tour across California's 31st District. The work they do, day in and day out, is challenging and exhausting but is crucial to our community and the environment. Big thanks to the Burrtec staff for letting me be part of the team and giving me the opportunity to learn more about their work, families and how they’re helping to shape our community.
Reminder: My Veterans Resource Fair is this Friday in Colton. Information on health care, housing and employment will be available for Inland Empire veterans, as well as assistance with VA claims.
Alt-Right = Neo-Nazis. White Supremacists = Neo-Nazis. White Nationalists = Neo-Nazis.  Mr. President: Stop defending or equating them with anything else.
Thank you to everyone who came to my Veterans Resource Fair today! We can and must do more to help our heroes when they come home, and that responsibility starts right here in the Inland Empire.

Had a great time this morning celebrating the birthdays of Medicare, Medicaid, and Social Security with the California Alliance for Retired Americans and #CA31 seniors! Seniors in the Inland Empire and across the US rely on these critical programs, and I'll continue fighting GOP efforts to gut them.

Our seniors shouldn’t have to worry about finding affordable housing options, but under the president’s proposed budget, critical housing programs face drastic cuts in funding. Today I met with Inland Empire seniors to assure them that despite the president’s proposals, I will continue to advocate for their right to live without the fear of losing their homes.
If you or someone you know is looking for work in the Inland Empire, please stop by my Jobs Fair in San Bernardino tomorrow. Top employers from our region will be there looking to hire!

My Inland Empire Jobs Fair is happening now and goes until 1:00PM! If you're looking for work in the Inland Empire, stop by the San Bernardino Boys and Girls Club. Top employers from our community are here and are looking to hire!

Thanks to all of the employers and job-seekers who attended my Jobs Fair on Friday! 58 local employers came out and were able to connect with over 300 Inland Empire residents looking for work. To get our economy back on track and put the Inland Empire back to work, we need local assistance as much as we need policy solutions. I’m glad that this Jobs Fair was able to provide that assistance for some families in our community.

Thanks to a grant from the US Department of Agriculture, SNAP/EBT recipients are now eligible for the City of Redlands' Market Match program at the Saturday Morning Certified Farmers’ Market and Thursday Market Night. This program will expand the buying power of low income families in our community and help boost revenues for local farmers. More info below:

Defending DACA is about staying true to our nation’s values and remembering that America is a place where immigrants can still succeed. We must give Dreamers an opportunity to succeed here, in the only home they’ve ever known.

Compassion goes beyond partisanship, and I'm glad to see that plans to protect Dreamers are getting support on both sides of the aisle. I hope that President Trump will heed these bipartisan calls and work with Congress to permanently preserve DACA.
Couldn't make it to the league so I had to settle for the next best thing! Thanks to the Inland Empire 66ers for hosting me on the latest stop of my Job for a Day tour.
‪This decision is nothing short of shameful. #Dreamers are a part of this country, and we must continue to fight for them and #DefendDACA‬.

Dreamers came to this country as children and have grown up as Americans, living and working in and contributing to our communities. These 800,000 young adults have done absolutely nothing wrong and sought the protection from deportation that was offered by our government so they could work here legally, and live without the constant threat of being sent back to a country they don't know. Now, President Trump has ended this protection, going back on the promise that was offered to them, that if they work hard and play by the rules they can pursue their dreams here in America. This is unspeakably cruel and confirms the racist cornerstones on which this Administration bases its policies. I will fight hard to protect Dreamers in the coming weeks and months - Congress must act.  I will not stand by and watch this government round up and deport Dreamers, these innocent bystanders who have had their futures stolen from them by an anti-immigrant, hardliner faction of the Republican party.

Today I joined my colleagues from both the House and the Senate to call on Republican leadership to give us a clean vote on the bipartisan Dream Act, a bill to provide Dreamers with a pathway to citizenship. This bill is the correct way forward, and I urge my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to ask Speaker Ryan to allow for a vote. More information on the Dream Act is available here:

I just joined my colleagues on the House floor to call for a vote on the Dream Act. If Speaker Ryan truly stands with Dreamers, he’ll let us vote on this bipartisan legislation to allow them to stay here.
I’m live now on the House floor asking Congressional leadership to bring the bipartisan Dream Act to the floor for a vote.

I’m proud to join Cal State San Bernardino in announcing these scholarships. Thanks to this funding, students from right here in the Inland Empire can begin careers in cybersecurity and help keep the US safe from modern threats while gaining the experience needed to compete in the 21st century economy.
On the anniversary of the September 11th attacks, we will never forget the lives taken from us by an act of cowardice or the response of unwavering courage we witnessed 16 years ago today.
Congress must come together to pass the bipartisan Dream Act. Dreamers grew up here, they went to school here, they’ve built lives here, and this bill can help keep them here.

My Job for a Day tour is all about getting out in the community and meeting the people that make up the Inland Empire Economy. Anthony Victoria with Inland Empire Community Newspapers has coverage of the latest stop on my tour here:
If you or a veteran you know receives care at the Loma Linda VA, please share your experience here! The survey will remain up until Friday, September 15th, and can be found here:

Hispanic Heritage Month is a time to reflect on the many contributions Hispanic Americans have made to our country, but also a time to remember that there is still work to be done to achieve full equality. Read my full statement on the start of Hispanic Heritage Month here:

I’m proud to announce that over $300,000 in federal funding has been awarded to San Bernardino County Fire as part of the Assistance to Firefighters Grant Program. This money will be used to purchase a mobile fire simulator, allowing for lifesaving training exercises throughout the county.
President Trump’s decision to end the DACA program left nearly 800,000 Dreamers wondering what their futures might hold. Join me tomorrow at San Bernardino Valley College to demand answers.

I’m proud to join KEYS Nonprofit, Inc. to announce this grant, which will provide over $625,000 to assist low-income veterans and their families in San Bernardino. We as a nation must do more to take care of our veterans, and this funding is a great start right here in our community.

I’m always honored to nominate Inland Empire students to our US service academies. If you or someone you know is interested in attending the United States Naval Academy, US Air Force Academy (Official), West Point - The U.S. Military Academy, U.S. Coast Guard Academy, or the United States Merchant Marine Academy, my office is accepting applications until October 6th!

When the president decided to end DACA, he put the futures of nearly 800,000 young people across this country, and tens of thousands here in our community, in jeopardy. For most Dreamers, the US is the only home they’ve ever known, and now they don’t know if they will be able to continue the lives they’ve built here. I’m working to establish a permanent solution by urging my colleagues to support the bipartisan Dream Act.

I was proud to announce this grant, which will provide the Redlands Fire Department with adequate funding to replace old safety equipment. Firefighters in our community risk their own wellbeing in the service of others, and I’m glad that this grant will go toward upgrading critical safety equipment.
Proud to stand with my colleagues to support a discharge petition to force a vote on the bipartisan Dream Act. Dreamers deserve a pathway to citizenship, and this legislation creates just that.

ICYMI: Last week, I was proud to announce that KEYS Nonprofit, Inc. received a grant to help low-income veterans in our community find affordable housing and financial stability. One of our top priorities as a nation should be helping veterans transition seamlessly to civilian life, and grants like this one get us closer to that goal.

Today I am heartbroken by the tragic and senseless shooting in Las Vegas. My thoughts are with the victims and their families, including all those affected here in the Inland Empire. I am grateful to the first responders who took lifesaving action last night, including those from our community.
If you or someone you know has DACA status set to expire before March 5th, the deadline to submit renewal applications is this Thursday, October 5th. Submit your application as soon as possible!
I was proud to join my colleagues today and call for Congressional action to reduce gun violence. We cannot afford any more empty promises, and Congress has an obligation to act now.

I’m happy to announce that I’ll be hosting a Town Hall Meeting for residents of California’s 31st District at Esri in Redlands on Monday October 16th! Please join me to discuss issues affecting the Inland Empire community. Register here:

I’m proud to announce that Elf Zone Inc., a Loma Linda based health care start-up, has received a Small Business Innovation Research grant of $300k to develop an experimental leukemia treatment. This funding has the potential to help save countless lives, and will help keep the Inland Empire on the cutting edge of cancer research.
I’m looking forward to a great discussion with residents of the 31st District in Redlands on October 16th! More information on my Redlands Town Hall and link to RSVP here:
As Hispanic Heritage Month comes to an end, we must continue to build on the progress of the Latino leaders who came before us by passing the Dream Act.
Reminder: I’m holding a Town Hall Meeting in Redlands on Monday, October 16th! If you are a resident of California’s 31st District, you can RSVP here:
We’ll be broadcasting my Redlands Town Hall starting at 6:30PM on Facebook live! Tune in for a discussion of the issues affecting Inland Empire families.
I'm live for my Redlands Town Hall:
NA
Thank you to everyone who came out to my town hall in Redlands last night! Your insights and feedback help me better represent the Inland Empire.

Today I announced over half a million dollars in funding toward fighting the opioid crisis in our community. While there is still more work to be done, I’m hopeful that this funding will help families in our community recover from this devastating epidemic.

Compassion is part of the American identity, and it must be extended to our immigration policies. This heartbreaking story is yet another example of why we must pass the Dream Act to help keep families together.
If you or someone you know is looking for health insurance, Open Enrollment through Covered California starts tomorrow! Use the link below to find more information and to get help with enrollment.
Mourning yet another tragedy today, knowing that my thoughts and prayers are not enough. We must take action.
This country is great because we uphold our values, and Congress has an opportunity to prove that by passing the bipartisan Dream Act.

The Dream Act gives Congress a unique opportunity to secure the future of over 800,000 young people in this country. Read my Op-Ed in the Inland Empire Community News about why we must pass this crucial legislation.

‪Today and every day, we are grateful for the service and sacrifice of our nation’s veterans, and our thoughts and prayers remain with all of the active duty service members around the world. Happy Veterans Day to all who served.‬
I’m proud to announce that 60 Inland Empire residents were hired by local employers as a result of my 3rd Inland Empire Jobs Fair. Thanks again to all who attended and participated!
The GOP Tax Plan was already awful, but now it’s getting even worse by raising health care costs for working families to carve out tax breaks for wealthy corporations. We have to defeat this.

The E-Commerce industry has become a major part of the Inland Empire, creating thousands of good-paying jobs in our community. Today I’m proud to join my friend Congressman Brett Guthrie to launch the Congressional E-Commerce Caucus. I look forward to working together on a bipartisan basis to discuss policies that have a direct impact on working families here in CA-31.

Today, the House will vote on a Republican tax bill that prioritizes tax breaks for wealthy corporations and leaves the middle class behind. Speaker Ryan needs to stop choosing billionaires over Inland Empire families.
‪From my family to yours, wishing everybody a safe and happy Thanksgiving! ‬

Congress has a responsibility to create a level playing field where Inland Empire families can succeed. By selling out the middle class to make room for tax cuts for the rich, the Republican tax plan does just the opposite.

Students across the Inland Empire are working toward educations that will help them find 21st Century jobs in our community. By eliminating the student loan interest deduction and taxing tuition waivers, the Republican tax plan would put their futures at risk.

Today marks two years since our community was devastated by a cruel and cowardly act of terror that took fourteen lives and injured twenty-two more. My thoughts and prayers remain with the survivors and their families, as well as the families of those who were taken from us. And I remain eternally grateful for the heroism of San Bernardino County’s first responders, who helped prevent an even greater loss of life through quick action and enormous bravery.   I will never forget the shock and the heartbreak I felt that day, but I will also never forget the sense of unity that was demonstrated by our community in the wake of this horrific attack. That day, and every day since, we have shown that we will not be bent by hatred, and that we will not be broken by violence. As our community continues to heal from the tragedy of December 2, 2015, I hope that you will join me in remembering the victims, advocating for the survivors and standing together as we continue to reject the evil ideals of hate, terror and division.

Nearly 11,000 Dreamers have lost their DACA status since President Trump decided to end the program on September 5th. Each day that we fail to act, we put the futures of more young people in jeopardy. Congress must act to pass the Dream Act now.
Over the weekend, I got a chance to write holiday cards for our troops deployed overseas with these little elves. Thanks to the 21 schools in CA-31 who helped us collect over 2,000 cards this year!

As firefighters continue to battle the fires raging in our community and throughout Southern California, my thoughts are with all the families affected. Please heed the warnings of first responders and evacuate if instructed to do so.

The House is currently debating H.R. 38, a dangerous bill that undermines commonsense gun laws in states like California. In the wake of tragedy after tragedy, we must take action to reduce gun violence. Putting more guns on our streets is not the answer.
76 years ago today, thousands of brave Americans gave their lives in defense of our freedom. May we never forget their courage or sacrifice.
Open Enrollment through Covered California runs until January 31st! If you or someone you know are looking for an affordable health plan, visit CoveredCA.com to #GetCovered!
Congratulations to Cajon Cowboy Football on a terrific season. We’re proud to have you representing the Inland Empire in the CIF Division 2-AA State Championship game on Friday!

Time and time again, we’ve seen local law enforcement take heroic actions to stop active shooters and save lives. My new bill will make sure that law enforcement agencies have the resources they need to prepare for and prevent future attacks.

Congressional Republicans must allow us to vote on a clean Dream Act immediately. The hundreds of thousands of Dreamers who have built their lives here cannot afford to put their futures on hold any longer.

Today, I voted against the GOP Tax Plan, legislation that cuts taxes for the top one percent at the expense of middle-class families.Tax reform should be about creating a level playing field for all Americans, not giving handouts to wealthy corporations.

Today, my bill to help our military service members transition to the civilian workforce cleared the final hurdle before moving to be signed by the president.   The Advance Act will help ensure that highly-skilled military personnel can more easily obtain commercial driver's licenses, allowing them to qualify for employment in one of the Inland Empire's fastest growing industries.
Today I joined Ari Shapiro of NPR’s All Things Considered to discuss my commitment to Protect Dreamers and the urgent need to pass the Dream Act. Listen in at 4:00PM PST.

My top priority has always been looking out for the working families across San Bernardino County, and I believe my End of Year Report reflects that. I’m proud to represent California’s 31st Congressional District, and I look forward to continuing to fight for Inland Empire families in 2018.
From my family to yours, Merry Christmas! Wishing everyone a safe and happy holiday.
